subject: Testing memory usage
msgSnippet: Has anyone done any work on unit test for memory usage of objects? What I d like to do is write a unit tests that asserts the memory used by a certain object
messageBody:
Has anyone done any work on unit test for memory usage of objects?

What I'd like to do is write a unit tests that asserts the memory used
by a certain object is less than a given value. Ideally I'd like to do
deep measurements that follow a complete object graph. For example, you
might measure that the total memory used by a list and all its members
were less than 100K. However, even being able to reliably measure the
shallow memory usage of an object without following an object graph
might be useful.

It seems to me that the issue here is not so much writing the test as it
is measuring the memory. i.e. one would really need to hook into the
virtual machine at a fairly deep level. Java doesn't seem to expose this
information at a high level. I've looked at the various profiler APIs,
but they seem to assume you're writing your code in C, not Java.

Any ideas?

--
